title: Simplifying
text: First, add the constant on both sides, to resemble the standard form. In this case, we add 36 to both sides.

title: Factor by Grouping
text: If possible, we then group the different variables, which in this case are x and y and factor their constants. In this case, we factor 4 from the x's and -9 from the y's.

title: Completing the Square
text: We then complete the square for both the variables, x and y.

title: Completing the Square
text: After completing the square, we have the equation, $$4{\left(x-3\right)}^2-9{\left(y+2\right)}^2=36$$

title: Simplification
text: To match it with the standard form, we then divide both sides to get 1, so in this case, we divide both sides by 36.
